courses.advice_detail_en: Perfect temperature for running. You can slightly increase your usual pace. Almost no wind, good for maintaining your pace. Surface is dry with low risk of slipping. Air quality is poor. If you have respiratory or heart issues, avoid intense outdoor running. Extra cautions: Air quality caution, Night caution. Adjust intensity based on how you feel and check your condition more often than usual.
